content: Yes, insecticidal soap can also be effective in controlling walnut webworms. Insecticidal soap works by suffocating the larvae of the webworms, causing them to die. It is important to use a mild, organic insecticidal soap that is safe for beneficial insects and follow the manufacturer's instructions carefully. It is also recommended to test the soap on a small area of the plant before applying it to the entire plant to ensure it does not harm the plant.
